mods.abstract: FIFTY DOLLARS REWARD--RAN away from the undersigned a negro man named Holmes, about 26 years old, 5 feet 10 inches high; has a scar on the right cheek bone under the eye, plain to be seen; is of a griff color; has a large head, a fine forehead, is very intelligent; inclines to lisp a little in his speech; has a short neck and is stout built; has a heavy beard; had a heavy moustache when he left but not whiskers. I bought him from Charles Cox, of Franklin parish, La. The above amount will be paid by the undersigned if Holmes is confined in jail out of this State so that I can get him, and twenty-five dollars if confined in jail in this State so that I can get him. I suspicion that Holmes has been abducted away by some white man. E. BLEECKER. Meadville, Miss., April 23, 1859. a27 1aw4t
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
